A committee that governs Capitol Hill access for broadcast journalists on Wednesday withdrew credentials for Kremlin-funded RT after the company complied earlier this month with a U.S. demand that it register under the Foreign Agents Registration Act.

MOSCOW -- A senior lawmaker said Friday that the State Duma could bar U.S. media from accessing the lower chamber of Russia's parliament in retaliation for the withdrawal of a Kremlin-funded television station's credentials in the United States.
Foreign correspondents in Russia can currently access the Russian parliament and some government agencies with their press credentials issued by the Russian Foreign Ministry.
Olga Savastyanova told Russian news agencies on Friday that she expected the Duma to adopt the ban next week.
Russia has denounced the move as a violation of media freedom.
